website_summaries.verdict: Great value, lightweight, and comfortable. These wired on-ear headphones swivel to fold down for easy portability.
pros: These headphones stand out for their portability
Store them away in your bag by folding them down
Durable cord is solid and resists tangling
cons: Users report the headphone jack can break after heavy use

customer_reviews.title: I loved these Stereo Headphones when I first got them
customer_reviews.text: I loved these Stereo Headphones when I first got them. They were comfortable to wear (I hate ear buds) and the sound was surprisingly good considering the low $15.00 Cost. Now the bad news, I've had the Headphones approximately two months and the connection through the plug has gone south. You have to constantly put pressure on the connector plug to get any sound at all. I guess I'll move on to another manufacturer test my luck there.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Love the look of these and the sound quality is ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these and the sound quality is good, particularly for the price. I have a small-ish head size and these boxed my ears so bad the first week I wore them. Ouch! Another reviewer mentioned to stretch them out by leaving them around a sofa armrest or something like that, and after doing that, I haven't had any trouble with my ears hurting.
customer_reviews.author: KristinM

customer_reviews.title: SERVICEABLE HEADPHONES FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for 2 years now up to the date of this review. Inexpensive and adequate but obviously not for the audiophile! Light so they don't hurt your ears after long wear. Dynamic range is within it's price range. A reasonable value for a knock around set of headphones. The vinyl coating over the ear covers has worn off on both sides and the covering flakes off onto you when you wear them. I guess it might have been affected by how I must put them on and off. Still using them and they still provide adequate sound.
customer_reviews.author: KTB

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, broke in less than two weeks.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones broke in less than two weeks with extremely minimal usage. One of the ear pieces fell off and they're unusable now. Poor construction and quality. I wouldn't at all recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: One side stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to use at home, but haven't used them myself. My husband has used them a handful of times while mowing the lawn. I got them out a couple of days ago to use them, and one side of them doesn't work at all. I'm really disappointed, they've barely been used at all, and, since it's been 8 months since I bought them, I can't return them. Complete waste of money. Now to find a new pair where I won't have the same problem!
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: The first week I used these headphones, they were fine. I have now had them a little over a month and the sound started going out. Part of the plug got stuck in the phone and I really can't afford a new phone as I'm on a fixed income. I ccan't wear ear buds and the last pair of Sony headphones I got lasted a couple of years. They would have lasted longer but I lost them when I had to move. I think they should last more than two months and now I'm shopping for something a little more expensive to get my money's worth. Save up and get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.G. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre Headphones. From the first day they kept acting up: slight and I mean SLIGHT pressure on the cord (specifically the L shaped part that plugs into your device), will cause songs to skip or pause. Doing that will also activate Google Voice for some odd reason. Imagine listening to your favorite song just to have it be interrupted by Google Voice 30 times, or have it skip to the next song before your favorite part comes on. I’ve purchased headphones from Sony in the past and I’m surprised that I received such a disappointing product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Probably a Great Design--I May Just Have a Faulty Example
customer_reviews.text: This is a provisional review--I've just started using these phones. The sound is great and the design is lightweight and very comfortable. But I'm a bit concerned about the fit of the 3.5mm jack. It doesn't seem tight enough. The connection to my MP3 player keeps coming loose, and this didn't happen with my previous phones, and also doesn't happen with the larger NC phones I use on flights. So I'm assuming that the issue is the Sony's jack not the player's socket.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brecher

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit the headphone jack.
customer_reviews.text: I am a stalwart purchaser of Sony products and was disappointed that the mini jack on the end of this headsets cord did not seat itself properly in my sound system. I would guess that it was a freak manufacturing error and not typical. I did manage to get sound out of the set and found that the volume was too low and the sound was not clear but "muddy". I purchased the Sony MDR-7506 headphones instead and they have the best sound of any headsets I have ever purchased. Those, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Day Trader

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this same type of headphones for the past few years. They never last long and they use to be much cheaper. When I first started buying them, the cost was about $15, then last year, they were up to $22, now - in stores, they're $30+. The cost goes up, but they never fix the issues. The padding on the ears flakes terribly, after just a few uses, and after several months, one side or the other stops working. The only reason I bought them again was because I found them on here for $21, which is still about 20 bucks more than what they're worth.
customer_reviews.author: Macalla

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Do not buy. We hardly used this item at all. We bought it in April 2018 and it broke in less then two months. Normally with a product from Sony it lasts forever and is good quality. I am not sure why this was a complete fail but I expect headphones to go longer then two months. I would give it a zero if amazon would let me.
customer_reviews.author: dak3535

customer_reviews.title: Walk Away from these
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace the last set of headphones that died after 30 days and decided on these. This purchase was a big mistake, the headphones are terribly inefficient and I have to turn the volume up all the way to barely hear them. The cord is a little short as well and the build quality is poor. I will be throwing these away and buying my next set of headphones locally.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Nark

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cheap set of wired headphones from Sony. The do what they're supposed to do, deliver sound in to your ears from whatever device you've plugged the 3.5mm audio jack in to. I use it to listen to audio from my laptop in bed when watching Netflix/TV/etc. while my spouse watches the regular TV. They are on-the-ear headphones so they probably won't be the most comfortable to wear for long periods of listening but they work just fine for me in short stints. I like that the jack is an L-shape so it doesn't just stick right straight out from whatever device it's plugged in to.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best headphones at this price out there
customer_reviews.text: 4 years ago I bought this same model from Walmart for $10. After 4 years and MANY drops, they finally died. I bought these as a replacement, so hopefully they hold up as long as the previous ones I had. Mic is the best in this price range, as is the sound. If they break on you I don't know what could have happened. They have decent noise cancellation as well. One thing I did notice, my head sorta put the old ones out of shape over time. So, if you get them and they feel too small, they will adjust to your head.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah K.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy - extremely poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was terrible... I’m not sure what product all of these people with great reviews had. Sound was crackling the entire time, it wasn’t comfortable on my head, and the latency was the worst! Do yourself a favor and don’t purchase. I wish I hadn’t. Would not recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted cheap headphones just to use for my iPhone for relaxing YouTube videos before bed. These are perfect. Nice sound. They are very comfortable and I can raise my iPhone to the loudest volume and they are not too loud, but I prefer 3/4 of the way. I got the white and they are nice looking, but padding around the ear could be made from better material though, they are very thin and I don’t know how long that will last, see photo.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer💫

customer_reviews.title: REVISED RATING:
customer_reviews.text: I use it to listen to audio books while exercising on bikes etc. Does excellent job of screening out most of surrounding sound and voice recordings are clear with excellent fidelity. FOUND THAT THEY DO NOT FILTER OUT SURROUNDING SOUNDS. REVISED> after 2 months of light usage, ear pads completely disintegrated into little black plastic pieces. Should have rated a "0" but unable to. They are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality for the price! As an adult wearing them, I was a bit worried as to how they fit since they looked smaller than expected but they're great. They're comfortable, easy to handle and I really enjoy the sound with this. The mic works perfectly as well and does a good job of cancelling out all any extraneous noise. I used to have Beats Studio headphones which I loved so I could tune it all out, but these work just as good and for a fraction of the price. Personally, if they broke I would just buy a new pair. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Roop

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones because I own a previous model of the same which have lasted me over 4yrs at least. These were so fragile, within the first 90 days one of the ear pieces fell off. It appears the convenient folding feature is not so convenient. It is a weak spot in the design. My headphones have not been usable. It is very sad because the quality of the headphones is fantastic but the design is very poor. I would not recommend the new design.
customer_reviews.author: Elisana Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: I made a mistake
customer_reviews.text: My mistake was typing in my previous headphone number, MDR-7502 (professional model), and expecting Amazon would match their quality with one of similar design. Not so. Always check the details. The headphones they sent had signal lines that were entirely too short and the sound quality was several steps below what my old Sony sets had. I haven't had time to check and see if the impedance matched the output of the computer equipment. However, the ear pads did fit one of the old sets nicely. So, I replaced them. Trouble is, I have a useless set of headphones in my collection now. Guess I'll save it for spare parts. Not enough expense to deal with this anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cook

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of an under pillow speaker!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't fall asleep without listening to a podcast or something. I was using an earbud and developed an ear infection. I started looking at under the pillow speakers. Most were crappy speakers and 20+! for ten bucks I figured I'd give these a try and break them off the headband. Turns out they fold up so nice and compact there's no need!!! I'll be using these next time I travel as well. They can pull double-duty on the plane as well as under the hotel pillow!! 3.5 mm plug is narrow enough to fit through my phone case to! A pleasant surprise as most are too thick and I have to take my phone out of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Will's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Fo$13.00 there are better choices.
customer_reviews.text: For the price these headphones are ok but there are better choices out there. First they are not very comfortable. There is no padding on the head piece. the padding for the ear cups is lacking. I would not want to wear these for any extended period of time. The cord is stiff and in my opinion not long enough. I purchased these for my wife to make Skype calls. For that they will work. Before you purchase these consider the Ailihen model# i35. Although they are marketed for kids, they are more comfortable in every way. The colors are fun. With both models you must remember, they are $13.00 phones.
customer_reviews.author: WA8UOC

customer_reviews.title: Used to be 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for adequate. This used to be a 4 star product, but newer production units are too bass heavy. The rich, full, balanced spectrum is what always made these such good headphones for the price, but unwise competition with 'bass enhanced' headphones, has ruined that quality. Still, among the best options in the sub $20 range. Much better quality, in every respect, than the comparably priced Amazon Basics headphones (which I packed up and returned, after less than one minute of listening)
customer_reviews.author: Snickers10

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality seems great. The response in the low frequencies is decent. I like that they fold up, but I likely won't use that feature much. Earpiece materials are soft, but it takes a little breaking in to be comfortable for long periods. I wish the cord was longer like my previous Sony headphones. This one is about 3 feet long. The cord itself is also a little less robust than my last headphones. Hopefully it lasts. The microphone works fine, and the mute button is convenient, although being a push button and not a toggle, it is hard to tell if you're muted or not.
customer_reviews.author: Travis H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sullen tweenage blocking of parental input.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work really, really well. So well than when my 11-year-old daughter puts them on she apparently can't hear a word I say. (Even though I've set the max volume on her phone to a safe listening level for her delicate ears.) In fact, these cans of sonic amazing are so effective I've had to take them away from her several times. Astonishing work, Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Holland

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but poor sounding but no surprise for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price and ability to fold them up they aren’t that bad but they offer poor sound quality at best. For the price I am satisfied I guess but for being SONY I’m not impressed in the slightest. They are fairly comfortable though. I do really like how the fold up though and bought a hard case here cheap which is perfect for why I bought these but the sound quality is seriously lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Bulky. Not Travel Friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Traveling and needed an additional headphone. Thought we'd give the "Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)" a try. We found it to be extremely bulky and quite heavy. This is contrary to the product description. Thus, not travel friendly. It is too big for younger kids and uncomfortable for adults to wear as well. The easy to fold swivel design is a plus but definitely not good enough to recommend this headphone. Furthermore, the padding around the headphones appears to be of poor quality. Hence, durability is questionable. Expensive for the quality. Expected better.
customer_reviews.author: DHTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: great for a SIMPLE headset
customer_reviews.text: These are Over the ear but ON the ear, not cups....so know that. I did and it's why I bought them. My father needed some simple, cheap but not crap lightweight headphones that were on the ear but not over or in the ear and these were the best we found after returning 4 pairs of various brand that either sounded horrible, fir weird or were too big or too small. They are super lightweight, nice long cord and sound great for the purpose. Not bassy much but not totally tinny either. for the money and what we wanted they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Faslane Tech

customer_reviews.title: NOT comfortable, especially with glasses. Width not adjustable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of reviews that said they were comfortable for people with glasses. Well, those folks must have small heads, because these headphones are the opposite - quite uncomfortable and tight. The pads are fine and the sound quality is good enough. While the ear pieces can be expanded up or down to give height, the width is fixed. It felt like it was squeezing my ears together, and mashing my ears down over the ear pieces of my glasses. I regret buying these things, and i’m back to the drawing board to find something that doesn’t feel like a vice clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Emma A

customer_reviews.title: Basic headphones
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones as an inexpensive option to replace an old pair of Sony noise-canceling headphones that had broken. The price is right on these, but the sound quality is weak. The bass is heavy and the treble is weak, making everything sound muffled. They're better than the average cell phone ear buds but far from ideal for serious music listening. They do collapse down nicely for transport, though. Overall, these are a good pair of basic, inexpensive headphones. But if you want quality sound, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: David Tombs

customer_reviews.title: Best Headphone in this price range by far!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones, I have bought several over the years. Are they comparable to 200.00 headphones? No...but you're paying 15.00. And for 15.00 you're getting the best headphones in this price range. I've bought MANY headphones in this price range and they are all junk, they would hurt my ears, sound like crap, slip off my head, or just break! Ugh! Finding good headphones can be tough. But these have always been good to me. Fit just right, not too tight on the ears, but not too lose as to fall off. Sound good, cushions are good. Ya can't go wrong...
customer_reviews.author: JessicaAnn

customer_reviews.title: Only adequate. Barely.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about these headphones is the price. The chord is just about long enough. They work adequately. I use them with a portable DVD player and have to crank the volume to maximum, which is adequate. Unless I’m eating something crunchy like toast, or near a fan. Then the volume is not loud enough. The bass is a bit diminished. They fold up nicely for easy storage. They are not big enough to fit around the ears. They sit on the ears. After about an hour they get a bit uncomfortable. If you have a large head, these are not for you.
customer_reviews.author: azfreediver

customer_reviews.title: they are comfortable (though if you have a bigger than average head ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to carry around, mainly to have something that isolates noice a bit more than EarPods, they do the job, they are comfortable (though if you have a bigger than average head they might not be as much) and the sound quality is ok (they do have a bass booster which helps not hearing external noises but its a hindrance if you are looking for sound quality). The material quality is also ok, I read a lot of reviews stating that these broke almost immediately, and though they are not sturdy or particularly well built they should last a good amount of time provided they are not mistreated. I give these five stars mainly because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worse sound quality than the free earbuds they give you on airplanes
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that these would deliver a decent listening experience for the budget. Given I usually use $9 earbuds, I figured these would be about the same in quality. FALSE. Plugged them in and tried them out -- right away I had to turn the volume all the way up to hear anything, and there was static and pulsing in my music and podcasts. Plugged in my old headset and experienced nothing of the sort. These headphones are garbage. I am returning them immediately. Save the time and DON'T BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Tatnall

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: I am a Sony guy. I have always been happy with their products. I bought these to play video games. I am not a big video game player. I play about two a year. I just need some cheap headphones so I can hear what is going on and not bother the people around. For the price these work great. I had a pair of Bose that were too small for my head and they feel apart after a year. These are better then those headphones. I should learn, always go Sony first.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Very Fine Product for Very Little Money
customer_reviews.text: Our previous ear phones had developed a terrible squeal/noise/grinding sound that was annoying. These are new and terrific. I did have to write an "L" and an "R" in white on the separate ear pieces because the manufacturer disguised that item in black-on-black. Other than that, they're great! My mistake. In looking at the ear phones again, the "L" and "R" are very tiny and in a very soft blue, which is almost invisible.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Sparks

customer_reviews.title: poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace an older model I had that the frame broke--but I am very disappointing with this model--they are cheaper made--,poor sound quality and noise reduction --the 3.5 connector did not fit well on my Sony radio/boombox and I did not like the L connector-- my older ones that I broke(dynamic stereo headphones MDR-V100) were very very much better sound quality and noise reduction -- the cord was also much longer and better heavier quality----I tried to find a comparable model to the old ones I had, but there is no comparison-- I would send these back ,but I'd already thrown the box---so I'm searching for some better headphones
customer_reviews.author: pattio

customer_reviews.title: Work for me.  Inexpensive, but not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older pair of Sony headphones that the leather on the ear pads was wearing off. I use these when I game on Xbox - NO THEY DON'T HAVE A MIC, I just use them to hear the game when at night and I don't want the TV blasting. They fold up pretty nice for storage when not is use. I'm sure there are far better headphones out there, but for the price I paid (around $10 on a deal of the day) I'm very satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my favorite Sony Walkman headphones, which are hard to find these days. Plus, I don't like earbuds. I use these in an office environment connected to a smart phone for listening to streaming talk radio, music and podcasts. They are comfortable and sound crisp with nice bass. The cord is thicker and more durable than what is found on other lightweight headphones. I can plug the jack into my phone without having to remove my phone case. As an added bonus, they work well at blocking out co-workers' conversations. At this price, it won't be a disaster of they got damaged or stolen. I recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: t-d-h

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much what I expected....
customer_reviews.text: It’s a budget headphone from a phenomenal brand. Just because it’s cheaper, doesn’t make it bad. Good sound, nice feel, fits well. Ear cups are comfortable for hours. Premium feel in build quality. Pretty much what you’d expect from a Sony product...
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A good pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these headphones have been great. They sound clear, with plenty of volume to go around. The cable/cord is furrowed for ease of movement and comes with a durable 90 degree plug. These headphones are also sufficiently comfortable. The padding is soft and the fit is large enough for my oddly shaped skull. Be careful folding these back down flat; the hinge appears to be a possible breakage point if not done correctly or with too much force. A hard-shell case might be worth considering if you plan to travel with this pair of headphones. Overall, I’m happy with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kooks Dan’o

customer_reviews.title: Sound is Okay, But Cord is Way Too Short
customer_reviews.text: On the fence about returning these; the sound isn't bad for the price, but the cord is too short to comfortably use with my computer. Now I need to rummage around in my Big Box Of Wires to see if I have an extension cable of some sort (which won't be good for the sound). Seriously, Sony, you couldn't have given us another foot of wire? UPDATE: I got an extension wire for an extra $6 and it works okay, but I now find that the short wire on the headphones insists on twisting itself like a snake. You're better off going for different headphones with a properly long and supple cord.
customer_reviews.author: Home Studio

customer_reviews.title: Budget headphones. Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Can't argue with 10$. Good for the price. Smaller than expected. Cheaper feeling wouldn't sit in them but decent when wearing. I have glasses doesn't interfere. Not over ear -- instead they sit on your ear so don't expect to wear these for extended periods but for my purposes (synths/sequencers/samplers) it makes a great backup headphone but not as great of a range of music lows are weak highs are peekid.
customer_reviews.author: Shinobiwizard

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and well priced considering construction.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap good quality headphones, serve their purpose and are pretty well constructed considering their price. If you need high end headphone to listen to the details on complex music then these are not for you, but if you need them for the airplane or listening to TikTok or a Netflix movie I think they’re awesome. I would buy again. I purchased the version without microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M

customer_reviews.title: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were for my grandson and he really likes them. For this price range the sound is smooth IMO. They do run a little small so would recommend for smaller heads. The drawback is not being able to regulate the sound so if one has hearing loss, this probably would not work unless wearing a hearing aide. If hearing is no problem then these headphones are really nice for the money.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyAboutBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price BUT
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting that much for $15, but they actually sound great unless you move. Sadly like ALL low end and even some high end Sony headphones there is far too much DIRECT contact noise from the flimsy chap headband into the drivers. the earphones need to be isolated from the headband by a non conductive joint. It's weird that they would make great drivers and put such a poorly designed cheap POS headband on it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a last minute replacement for the $20 ones that were a lost order. My son needed them for school and since I could get them cheap and fast, I clicked the button. And it turned out to be a good thing! They work great and I am planning to get another set in black this time for him to use at home. (Chose white first since I could clearly label his name on them).
customer_reviews.author: detentionplz

customer_reviews.title: THESE INEXPENSIVE HEADPHONES ARE A GREAT BARGAIN  !!
customer_reviews.text: I needed headphones for my TV, (not Bluetooth) as my hearing is going. So I started shopping for headphones. I bought and returned many different headphones, from pricey ones to less pricey...none of them were any good, they all seemed to muffle the speech on the screen. So I decided to just buy these smaller, lighter ones, and forget it if they were no good. Ironically, they are the BEST of all the ones I tried. The sound is clear and crisp, and they are light and comfortable. Not sure why the others were so bad...maybe I was buying the wrong kind?? Who knows? These are great. May buy a second pair for backup.
customer_reviews.author: Sagesmoke

customer_reviews.title: $14 headphones, but they don't feel like Sony.
customer_reviews.text: They are $14 headphones so I wasn't expecting $100 experiences and they get the job done, but I guess with the name brand Sony, I was expecting a bit more. The cups get hot and sweaty on me, they don't sit firm to my head and I have a BIG head. (I often have one ear cup behind my ear. Sound quality is passable but not what I expect from Sony. However. They are $14... Sooooo am I expecting too much?
customer_reviews.author: Peter Foster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect buy!
customer_reviews.text: For my needs, just to watch videos, these are fantastic! They're quite adjustable and fit nicely without irritating my ears its easy to forget they are on. They will not cancel out much loud noise around me, but I didn't buy them for that. I turn off the TV and I kick everybody out of the house, instead. Sound is clear and excellent so your ears concentrate to it automatically. They wrap loosely around your neck if you just need to move them temporarily. The cord is about 3' long, enough to reach about your desk w/o removing the headphones - not much more. Again, they are quite comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Give Poetry

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but needs stronger wire-jack connection.
customer_reviews.text: This is our fourth pair of these Sony headphones. They sound fantastic and look nice. Cord is nice and long. Con-all four pairs have eventually (within 6 months) shorted out at the jack point. Wiggling the wire to get them to work is a major bummer and of course they outlast the 30 day return period.
customer_reviews.author: BellaBean

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable and Low Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: The material on the ear padding was not at all durable (see photo), and the headhpone jack degraded so that it would only work if maintained in a specific orientation. The sound quality was also poor. I do not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Triangle123

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are terrible. I did not expect the sound quality to be so bad. I made a mistake in believing a Sony product would mean I would be getting a product of superior quality, I was wrong. I have seven dollar headphones that sound much better. They should not be charging more than five dollars for these, due to terrible sound quality. Shame on Sony, I no longer trust the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good for the price. VERY comfortable for inexpensive headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good for the price. VERY comfortable for inexpensive headphones. Sound quality is fair, for the price it is great. While wearing them I can still hear to some extent of what is going around me. In some situations it could be actually a good thing. I could wear them for 4 hours straight without feeling any discomfort. Many other products I tried were causing pain around my ears just after half an hour, were not sounding as good and were more expensive. I guess it's hard to go wrong with Sony when comes to headphones regardless of the tier of the product.
customer_reviews.author: wk

customer_reviews.title: These sound way better than their price point would suggest.
customer_reviews.text: I have listened to headphones ranging up to $500 and while these are not comparable to the best I have used, they are way better than I was expecting for $15. They are weighted a bit toward base, but I expect that base is what the target demographic for headphones at this price point is looking for. We got them for listening to foreign language CDs on a portable player and for practicing on the keyboard. They are excellent for our purposes and are comfortable and clear-sounding enough to be acceptable for listening to music. Far better than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Russ in Elk Grove

customer_reviews.title: Bad noise cancelation
customer_reviews.text: I wish the noise cancelation was better but its actually pretty bad I can hear my wife talking on the phone from across the room..Other than that I realy like them. The sound is great. And they are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap disposables, but don't expect them to last over a year
customer_reviews.text: Pros Cheap, acceptable audio quality for the price. Foldable. Relatively durable. Are gentle with the amount of pressure put on the ears. Cons They tend to break within a year. In most cases wiring in the cable near the headphone jack fails. I've had three units fail in this particular way. The rubber-molded-with-wire-inside cabling is not easy to repair. I was unsuccessful. In another case, the drivers began to rattle, as if blown out, but don't remember ever playing loud audio on these headphones. They really are disposable, not easy to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Weinert

customer_reviews.title: Good Inexpensive Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are nice headphones for the price. At first I thought they were too bass heavy, but I got used to them. There is some bass coloration, but it's not displeasing. My previous headphones had just one cord connecting to one side, but these split into two. This can be a little annoying. I typically only use them with my phone for watching movies or YouTube, and pretty much only in bed, so once situated the cords aren't a big problem. I would not subject these to rough use as they are a bit fragile feeling but, as I said, they are very good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Can take a beating and is good for kids as well as adults
customer_reviews.text: I am as always impressed with Sony headphones in general for 30+ years. This set can take a beating. I have given one of them to a 10 year old and one to a 18 year old over one year ago and they are still alive. The white one can look dirty more easy but it can clean off easy too. Sound quality is great too. The cord is sturdy, too. And for the price you don't have to worry if somebody steals them. I would definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids age 8 and up
customer_reviews.text: As a first headphone for kids, this is perfect. Its sound signature is almost neutral with a bit of focus on the base, which is fine for the most of sound experience kids are exposed to (latest pop songs and games). The hardware itself is beautifully designed without being too bulky. Unit is very light on the head. The most impressive thing is the cable - it is very hard to tangle this thing and the length is just about right. I'd highly recommend this headphones for parents that are looking for something for their kids so the house is not filled with the game sound effects or the youtubers excited screams.
customer_reviews.author: TABULA RASA

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for a cheap set of headphones.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these that I have purchased. I use them with the computer while I'm working so that I don't disturb others around me. The sound quality is decent for inexpensive headphones. They are very light weight and fit comfortably on top of my ears. The only reasons I replaced the last set was because the cover material that Sony uses over the padded earpieces is very cheap/thin and over the years has disintegrated, and the adjustment fit was wearing out. The first set lasted me about six years, if not longer, so I expect I'll have these for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Tight on head but good sound
customer_reviews.text: We bought these after we broke our light-weight Sony's --- we use 'em all the time to hear TV since often one or the other of us would rather read than watch TV. The sound quality is good but the headset fits fairly tightly over the head with a good deal of pressure on the ear --- this design does help cut ambient noise but you pay for it with less comfort. Not a good choice for us since reading usually does not generate much sound to distract the TV watcher! I would expect that they would serve well in a more noisy environment.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bill

customer_reviews.title: They work, but not loud
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a while, and use them as a backup if my other headphones break. but it seems like they dont get very loud. Like they'll only reach 40% volume of what other generic headphones you could buy
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I should of known better then to buy headphones for this price, but always liked Sony products. For the price they are OK but they feel cheap and sound really like cheap headphones. They are small and feel like they are a kids size. You can get a lot better headphones for not that much more. I will give these to the thrift store, not worth using to me.
customer_reviews.author: tpen007

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a little uncomfortable. I use them on my morning one hour walk. My ears are pretty sore after the hour as I wear glasses and these headphones are tight. I may experiment with trying to loosen the tightness but I don't know how. The sound quality is pretty darn good with decent (not great) bass response. These are a HUGE improvement over the in ear headphones I was using. Of course there are much better sounding headphones available but for the price, HOLY MOLY! I am quite pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hull

customer_reviews.title: Strike 3 you're out!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this originally 8/1/18. Arrived damaged, received replacement a few days later. Lasted 4 months - December 2018 it no longer worked. Thought it was a fluke and trusted "Amazon's Choice" again when reordered the end of January 2019. Just died again - 10 months later. If you're looking for an inexpensive headset that will last a few months this will do the trick. I hoped I'd get a few years out of it. I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Schulman

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but super fragile
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for such a cheap price. Used them with online games that require 3D sound. Sadly the actual audio jack is incredibly fragile. My first pair was bent while traveling in a suitcase. I ordered 2 more because I thought It was just a bad set. But now after 3 sets of these I have to assume there is a manufacturing flaw that makes the actual connection so weak that any strain on it causes it to fall apart. The male end just falls out with even moderate strain. Sound quality is excellent but they are just cheaply built I guess.
customer_reviews.author: bigbaldguy

customer_reviews.title: these things DEFINE value
customer_reviews.text: There are subtleties to achieving a soft, comfortable fit, especially for long-term listening. These achieved that 'hardly know they're on' fit. sound? These have an audiophile-like FLAT (NOT bass boosted) flat frequency response, yielding a delightfully OPEN sound with amazing clarity and definition. And for this price? YaGottaBeKiddinMe !!! `can't think of a better use for a sawbuck. No need to 'think about' these; just get `em. From a life-long audiophile nut, you won't regret them.
customer_reviews.author: Discoveror

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These inexpensive headphones have light-weight drivers that can't produce good, full bass, but they are comfortable to wear. Some people may find the cord a bit short, but for use with a laptop it's just long enough and the right-angle plug is good. I was not expecting much at this price point, so I am not really disappointed. They fold up nicely for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Richard S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: These fit nicely but do nothing for noise control. In fact, I feel as if they actually amplify the ambient noise at the gym - particularly the machines and that horrid spin class instructor who bellows like the exorcist!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I am elderly, retired and a bit hard of hearing. Listen to ballgames, videos and music for hours a day; and I listen to everything using these headphones so that I won't disturb my neighbors. They are comfortable and the sound quality is amazing for headphones at this price. Still have a pair of ZX-100s that I've been using for years and they continue to work perfectly; although the material that covers the padding is beginning to flake off onto my ears. That's why I got the ZX-110s which, basically, are the same thing. Highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer Noir

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but requires EQ
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable headphones, with soft ear pads that just ease onto your ears. However, the frequency response is definitely biased toward the lower end, so you'll need to adjust your EQ to bring up the higher end, starting with where the vocals live. Therefore, I would not recommend these for cheap accurate music listening (panasonic and koss have better offerings under $20), but for something really comfortable to wear while watching youtube videos or playing video games, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Joon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: For talk radio and voiceover work, I sometimes need to hear what else is going on in the studio or surrounding area. These work very well for that purpose. They also travel well by folding. (When I don't want to hear outside sounds, I use noise-cancelling headphones.) I thought the first pair I bought had a faulty mini-plug wire. Wrong. It was tiny debris in the female jack. I was going to return the "faulty" pair. The replacement arrived the very next day! I have now decided to keep both, using one as a back-up or for talk radio guests as they are very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jensen

customer_reviews.title: caveat emptor
customer_reviews.text: The pair I got the ear pieces do NOT swivel - so one of the sides will press hard into the outer/rear part of your ear. I wasn't necessarily going for cheap (all the others were $50 and up, though), I wanted one with NO mic. These are hideous. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Did you know a THIRD WTC building fell on 911?

customer_reviews.title: Keep away from underneath your platform rocker/recloiner chair, especially away from the footrest.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones until I jumped up to answer the phone, then came back to sit down and . . . CRUNCH! The left phone became detached from the headband and my "Rubik's cube" skills were inadequate for re-connecting them together. The fabulously intricate "ball joint" is great for folding things flat, but impossible to put back together, once it comes apart. I'm returning it for refund (I hope) and ordering another. This thing cannot possibly be put together except maybe at the factory.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nooo way
customer_reviews.text: These are beyond cheap and they annoyed the crap out of my ears until I got a headache. Lots of echo, and they dont fit. I just went for the ps4 'last of us 2' version headset and it works perfect with excellent sound. Worth spending the money if you can, avoid these. I hadn't realized how far the 'dongle Bluetooth' had evolved since I had a pair of turtle B a couple years ago. It's stupid easy now, so no need to ever wire in for avoiding obnoxious setup. Pop it in and go wireless.
customer_reviews.author: SrvivlKittsn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect low-cost phones for the public library...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite "library" headphones. I use them to listen to CDs from iTunes on my MBPR. They don't muffle out all outside sounds (so what), but they do prevent others from being bothered with my musical choices. Excellent quality, especially at the price point. I listen to lots of newer jazz (D. Holland, D. Douglas, B. Stenson. W. Leo-Smith, W. Parker, D.S. Ware, B. Frisell) - throw in some U2, Cowboy junkies, N.Young, B. Laswell etc - NO complaints. You can wear these for hours without notice, even with reading glasses. At the price they are easily replaceable if lost, broken, whereas having to replace. say, a pair of HD598 CS might get me pissed off.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ambelang

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for $15, but not good enough for music production.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, I'm not entirely suprised by the lack of sound quality. It had so many good reviews, so I gave it a shot, but if you're looking for headphones that will deliver quality sound capable of mixing or any type of music production, spending at least $50 is mandatory. For $15, these are probably the best quality headphones on the market, just not quite enough for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie P.

customer_reviews.title: Sony still has great products
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, really great price. Not loud enough for me, and they are not that snug. Whole lotta bass. Can't complain for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous sound, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe earphones this inexpensive can sound this good. What a joy! I can tell from only a few minutes what a pleasure these will be. I'm listening to the Beethoven Violin Concerto - pure sound throughout the range. The fit is comfortable for me. I didn't want noise-cancelling so it's fine with me the headphones only dim sound, not cancel it. Sometimes one gets a product that you know is just right. This is such a product for me. Thank you, Sony!
customer_reviews.author: WEA Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not for audio enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased to replace my really old Sony headphones from around the same price point, but they're not even close. The audio is very biased, which makes the bass too heavy and sound digital. Luckily my kid needed a pair of headphones, for low volume listening, for school so they got handed off instead of returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for inexpensive headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great for no frills $10 wired headphones my kids will likely break in a week. Great for travel too! Decent sound. Cushioned comfort, wide and sturdy headpiece. On-ear adult headphones are just right for little kids. Not too heavy. My over ear studio headphones were too big and heavy for my little ones. This pair doesn’t have volume limitation for kids, but I’ve found it doesn’t work anyway. Limit volume on the device instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mic is horrible.  I got yelled at crucial meetings and opting for refund.
customer_reviews.text: Headphone sound is good. But Mic is horrible. It did not work, even at the first meeting. I tried all option to click the button in the wire and adjust it. No luck. The Mic lead me to embarrasment in 2 crucial meeting for my career. I had to opt out and use my mobile phone's and hold it by hand, and could not operate the laptop keyboard. Horrible product. I luckily have an insurance on this product. So i will return and claim a refund. Bad design of the adjustable switch like knob in the Wire. Mic is NOT working. Total failure of the Mic. I am totally disappointed. With Amzaon Choice and this Sony product.
customer_reviews.author: Selwin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure that this deserves a five-star but I gave it one anyways. For $15 they are incredibly lightweight super basic sound pretty decent as far as noise cancelling goes it's pretty good I mean if someone's screaming or talking super super loud you're going to hear them and you can almost kind of hear a muffle of a voice if someone's talking but barely. I was trying to replace ones I had years ago and turns out I bought the wrong brand anyways but these will do until they break and I'll buy another cheap pair
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Can't move & have sound on both sides.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with sound only coming from right side. Wanted to return, but had to use tech support to trouble shoot. Very annoyed going through this timely process to no avail. I may have received that one bad set that slips through the cracks, but why must I keep them? I listen to my audio-books stiffly, afraid to move and lose sound. Tired of short term fixes.
customer_reviews.author: Kiaya

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed 😔
customer_reviews.text: So much for name brand being better... The sound quality is horrible and the noise cancellation is non-existent.. I would have been better getting a pair from my local dollar store. They work but eh that's about it. They dont have noise cancellation.. They fit very weird, almost like they're too big for my head. I have them adjusted as small as they'll go too. Well you live and learn, I'll use these until they stop working, and judging by past reviews that will be about 1-4 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Sound like they should be triple the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the Casio keyboard I just got for my Birthday and I am very pleased. They fit very well with no discomfort and the light weight allows me to forget I’m wearing them. The sound quality is much better that I would have expected at this point, they would like they cost much more. They do not cancel background noise all that well but that ways not a feature I wanted, I need to hear what is going on around me. I would buy these again, but with Sony’s reputation for quality, I don’t think I will need to
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Haagsman

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my daughter who is doing distance learning this year due to covid19. I wasn't expecting too much with a $20 price tag, but I was very pleasantly surprised! They fit comfortably and the noise canceling feature really does work. She can speak to her teachers easily. My only issue is there is not a mute button on the microphone, but luckily she can use the mute feature on the laptop. So it works out. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Myers

customer_reviews.title: excellent $10 headfones
customer_reviews.text: i love nice headphones- really. But most of the time I need a 'cheap' set of headfones. These are perfect to bang around, throw into a gear bag, give to your kid, or listen to boring webinars. The quality is fantastic for $10, and when I sit on them, I won't be too bummed
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Issue with computer connection
customer_reviews.text: While the sound quality and control is excellent on phone and iPad, the headphones have a weird tendency to cut out when at a specific angle. This is NOT because of repeated use as it has been happening since I first took the headphones out of the box. Also as many other users stated the longevity of the headphones is short due to the light wire connection between the headphones and audio wire. Good thing that these weren’t too expensive or else I’d be more upset.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: SUITABLE
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for low priced, basic headphones in the $10 - $15 price range and these fit the bill. Was hoping they would cover the entire ear but that is not the case. Still, these seemed to be a pretty good value for the money and I have been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cat In The Hat

customer_reviews.title: Decent for general purpose
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the name. I thought they would be better but I literally just paid for the name because they do not sound like Sony. maybe I shouldve bought the next level up? I bought my son some gaming headphones for $9 on Amazon that perform significantly better but unfortunately I need headphones without a microphone so I will still be using these but for everyone else just know if you plan on using them for entertainment or movies that's fine but I would not recommend them for any type of music production or audio monitoring and thats from a professional stand point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: one ear will break within a month
customer_reviews.text: Used to be loyal to this model or similar ones. The quality seems to have dropped, and it took buying these a few times to realize this cause I thought that surely it must be a fluke. Constantly in one ear the sound goes out from casual home use. I've had to buy earbuds while on vacation cause these can't bounce around in a backpack without snapping or the ear going out.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Fits the bill
customer_reviews.text: If you're reading these reviews, you're looking for affordable headphones with decent sound and construction, right? In short, these headphones fit the bill; they are cheaply constructed, foldable headphones that look decent and sound average. I would not use them for more than 2 or 3 hours because your ears will be in pain. In this case, you're better off spending a little more for over-ear headphones and not these on-ear ones.
customer_reviews.author: windmillion

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Headphones for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones for the price. Sound is good not great you would need to buy more expensive headphones for better quality. I bought it for comfort since any headphones in my ears gets uncomfortable and always pops out if I move my head. I love that it has a Mic so I can answer calls on my cell phone when listening to music or an audio book. Also love it for conference calls because it covers both my ears and helps keeping noise around me from being a distraction.
customer_reviews.author: Cbuckley

customer_reviews.title: Ear Crusher
customer_reviews.text: These are not something you can wear all day. I'm pretty sure I'm going to have an ergonomic issue with my ear. Literally feel pain after an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Irizarry

customer_reviews.title: Someone said these headphones were great for people who wear glasses
customer_reviews.text: Someone said these headphones were great for people who wear glasses. I wore them for 10 hours when I accidentally beat the entirely of soul reaver 2 on twitch stream. (I got caught up in the story..I love that game) None of that behind the ear ache that you get with other headphones. Nothing like that. Very light weight headphones. No surround sound though, so if you want that you'll have to look elsewhere. otherwise they're perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Sony headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 sets for my 2 kids to do online school. They seem to be good and comfortable as no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are nice cheap headphones, we buy them for the kiddos and they seem to hold up to... well how children treat things. My daughter ( age 8 ) is a huge music nut already and she wears these for hours a day without discomfort. After a pair got destroyed, I ordered another and she was so incredibly happy to get the same pair. $14 to have my daughter pumped up, happy and listening to music instead of staring at a screen? Yea... I'll take that all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Harvanek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones for work, as I sometimes need to be able to listen to projects I work on without disturbing my coworkers. I have great success with Sony headphones in the past and these are no different. They are comfortable and the cord length is ideal. Sound quality is more than adequate for my needs. The way they fold up makes it easy to store when they are not being used. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: snowgrind

product_meta.title: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
product_meta.description: Style:No Mic| Color:BlackMaximizing your personal audio experience has never been easier than with SONY ZX-Series Monitor headphones. Built with comfort and performance in mind, there's no need to compromise.
feature_bullets: 30 millimeter drivers for rich, full frequency response
Lightweight and comfortable on ear design
47 ¼ inch (1.2 meter) tangle free, Y type cord

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars22,134 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #1 in Over-Ear Headphones#2 in On-Ear Headphones
